sentence.Network_en: The lights of the car lit up a signpost.
A signpost indicated the right road for us to follow.
sentence.Network_cn: 路标指给我们应走的路.

sentence.Network_en: We drove past a signpost I couldn't read.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们驶过一块路标,可是我读不懂.

entry.def: A signpost is a sign where roads meet that tells you which direction to go in to reach a particular place or different places.

example.ex: The lights of the car lit up a signpost...
Turn off at the signpost for Attlebridge.
example.tran: 在路标处拐弯去往阿特尔桥。

entry.def: A signpost is something that helps you to know how a situation or a course of action will develop.

example.ex: The outcome of tomorrow's elections will be studied carefully as a signpost of voter intentions on the really big day this year...
example.tran: 明天的选举结果会被作为今年大选的选民意愿风向标来仔细研究。

example.ex: These events were all signposts pointing toward change.
example.tran: 这些事件都是将要进行变革的征兆。

means.word_mean: 1. a post bearing a sign that gives directions or shows the way
1. mark with a signpost, as of a path

auth_sentence.content: The words 'To Northwold' upon a newly whitewashed signpost.
auth_sentence.res_content: The words 'To Northwold' upon a newly whitewashed signpost.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The words 'To Northwold' upon a newly whitewashed signpost.

auth_sentence.content: It is also a signpost on the path we tread.
auth_sentence.res_content: It is also a signpost on the path we tread.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It is also a signpost on the path we tread.

auth_sentence.content: So Clinton provides this perfect signpost in history for Obama.
auth_sentence.res_content: So Clinton provides this perfect signpost in history for Obama.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: So Clinton provides this perfect signpost in history for Obama.

sentences.en: I have tried to provide some signposts.
sentences.cn: 我曾经尽力提供一些标志物。

sentences.en: We drove past a signpost I couldn’t read.
sentences.cn: 我们驶过一块路标, 可是我读不懂。
